Save a named value of any type on the cursor.
Check if the cursor already has the given tag.
Check if any yielded cursors on the graph already have the given tag.
Find all the yielded cursors on this graph with the matching tag and cancel them.
Find all the yielded cursors on this graph and cancel them.
Remove the given tag from this cursor. If other cursors are waiting on us, they will resume.

Optional. After taking an OnCanceled outflow, signal to any observers that this cursor is now canceled. Equivalent to not handling the original cancel outflow. If you don't use this, handling OnCanceled will be treated as success.

Optional. After taking an OnFailed outflow, signal to any observers that this cursor is now failed. Equivalent to not handling the original fail outflow. If you don't use this, handling OnFailed will be treated as success.

Return the number of elements in the array.
Set the number of elements in the array.
Returns up to the maximum requested elements. Never grows the array (unlike SetCount).
Copy 'element' to the end of 'a', increasing its count by one.
Insert 'element' in the given index in 'a', increasing its count by one and moving the elements after index.
Remove the element at the given index in 'a', decreasing its count by one and moving the elements after index.
Remove all elements from 'a' which compare equal to 'element'.
Remove all elements from 'a' which are invalid instances.
Add the array 'b' to the end of 'a'.
Randomizes the order of items in the array (Knuth/Fisher-Yates Shuffle)

Get the current rotation speed (deg/s) of the attached object about the motor's axis. May differ from the motor's target speed.
Sets the time the motor takes to spin up to a greater target speed when it's on.
Sets the time the motor takes to spin down to a lesser target speed when it's on.
Sets the inertia scale on the motor, which affects the maximum amount of torque it can generate (this will also affect the actual time the motor takes to spin up or spin down).
Teleport the target entity.
Teleport the entity specified by the parameter override. Use this to teleport an entity other than the one specified in the Entity To Teleport field.

Teleport the target entity to wherever the point_teleport entity is currently. The Teleport input teleports to the initial position of the point_teleport, so this input was added to avoid breaking old content.
Teleport the entity specified by the parameter override to wherever the point_teleport entity is currently. The Teleport input teleports to the current position of the point_teleport

Inflictor is the entity that is dealing the damage.
It can be the attacker itself or a summoned unit, a projectile entity of some sort.
It is *MOST DEFINITELY NOT* the weapon or ability. Use Set/GetAbility for that.
